repository.name: storybook
repository.description: Storybook is the industry standard workshop for building, documenting, and testing UI components in isolation

issue.body:
## üßë‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüßë Who: @JReinhold, @ndelangen and @ghengeveld 

This is a tracking issue for the Component Testing Enhancements üîß project. The purpose of this issue is to keep tracking of the overall status of the project and tasks, and plan everything around it. This project is a continuation of #29088 and is related to #29529 and #29530.

# ‚ö†Ô∏è Problem

There was a few unresolved items in #29088 that we want to work on to improve the Component Testing experience. Further more, we're continuously receiving feedback on the new feature that we want to address.

# Tasks

body:
We can fix this problem, but the underlaying issue of this repro is the multiple versions of storybook being installed.
(multiple CLI versions, multiple core package versions)

This is causing `npm` to hoist some packages, and not others.
I've looked at what it's doing, and merging `@storybook/core` and `storybook` package would actually help, I think. (though I did not try this, so am not sure it would resolve all)

What I was able to do was hack the `node_modules` a bit to essentially have the `require.resolve` around the string.

That solves the issue, and I'm able to run the tests.
I'll open a PR.

But it does feel like this monorepo setup is not in a state, that seems long-term supportable.

issue.title: Addon Test: Wrap sub-paths exported with `require.resolve`

repository.name: storybook
repository.description: Storybook is the industry standard workshop for building, documenting, and testing UI components in isolation

issue.body:
Closes #29785

## What I did

- [x] wrap the sub exports with `require.resolve`

## Checklist for Contributors

### Testing

<!-- Please check (put an "x" inside the "[ ]") the applicable items below to communicate how to test your changes -->

#### The changes in this PR are covered in the following automated tests:

- [ ] stories
- [ ] unit tests
- [ ] integration tests
- [ ] end-to-end tests

#### Manual testing

I manually verified this resolved the problem by copying and pasting `node_modules` `dist` files into the repro supplied in the issue.

### Documentation

<!-- Please check (put an "x" inside the "[ ]") the applicable items below to indicate which documentation has been updated. -->

- [ ] Add or update documentation reflecting your changes
- [ ] If you are deprecating/removing a feature, make sure to update
      [MIGRATION.MD](https://github.com/storybookjs/storybook/blob/next/MIGRATION.md)

## Checklist for Maintainers

- [ ] When this PR is ready for testing, make sure to add `ci:normal`, `ci:merged` or `ci:daily` GH label to it to run a specific set of sandboxes. The particular set of sandboxes can be found in `code/lib/cli-storybook/src/sandbox-templates.ts`
- [ ] Make sure this PR contains **one** of the labels below:
   <details>
     <summary>Available labels</summary>

  - `bug`: Internal changes that fixes incorrect behavior.
  - `maintenance`: User-facing maintenance tasks.
  - `dependencies`: Upgrading (sometimes downgrading) dependencies.
  - `build`: Internal-facing build tooling & test updates. Will not show up in release changelog.
  - `cleanup`: Minor cleanup style change. Will not show up in release changelog.
  - `documentation`: Documentation **only** changes. Will not show up in release changelog.
  - `feature request`: Introducing a new feature.
  - `BREAKING CHANGE`: Changes that break compatibility in some way with current major version.
  - `other`: Changes that don't fit in the above categories.

   </details>

<!-- greptile_comment -->

## Greptile Summary

This PR fixes module resolution issues in monorepo setups by using `require.resolve` to get absolute paths for coverage reporter and setup files in the Storybook test addon.

- Added `packageDir` constant using `require.resolve` and `dirname` to get absolute package root path in `vitest-manager.ts`
- Updated coverage reporter path in `vitest-manager.ts` to use absolute path with `join(packageDir, 'dist/node/coverage-reporter.js')`
- Modified setup file paths in `vitest-plugin/index.ts` to use absolute paths with `packageDir` 
- Fixed issue where Vitest failed to resolve `@storybook/experimental-addon-test/internal/coverage-reporter` in monorepo environments



<!-- /greptile_comment -->

issue.title: Merge pull request #22 from fcxmarquez/franciscomarquezsolt/fcx-22-rebuild-layout

repository.name: enki-ai
repository.description: A customized chat ui in development compatible with Mixtral, GPT's family, Gemini, Ollama, among others

issue.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Introduced a comprehensive Storybook setup with stories and documentation for components, colors, typography, and responsive design.
  - Added a fully featured, responsive sidebar system with navigation, favorites, workspaces, and user badge components.
  - Added new UI primitives: Button, Input, Popover, Dropdown Menu, Sheet, Collapsible, Separator, Skeleton, Tooltip, and Breadcrumb components.
  - Added hooks for mobile viewport detection.

- **Enhancements**
  - Refactored global CSS to use a semantic, themable color system with improved dark mode support.
  - Updated configuration for Tailwind CSS v4 compatibility and improved border/color variables.

- **Chores**
  - Removed Chakra UI theming and related dependencies.
  - Updated ESLint, lint-staged, and PostCSS configurations for Storybook and Tailwind CSS v4.
  - Added and updated dependencies for Storybook, Radix UI, Vitest, Playwright, and related tooling.

- **Bug Fixes / Style**
  - Adjusted various component styles for improved focus, shadow, and background consistency.

- **Tests**
  - Added Vitest configuration for Storybook story testing.

- **Documentation**
  - Extensive Storybook stories and MDX documentation for design system components and usage.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
